name: House of the Moon

13929.name: {$M{7i{&n{#st{&r{7e{$l's G{7a{&l{#l{7e{&r{$y{0
description: As you enter the Minstrel's Gallery you notice
that it wraps around the Narthex and the Entrance
Hall. A beautiful marble ledge allows you to have a
full eagle-eye view of the Narthex and the Entrance hall.
As sweet music hums in your ear as you get caught
up in the moments of true art and fantasy.

13924.name: {&West Dome{0
description: This tower attic resembles an elongated
dome that stretches twenty feet in height.
As you look around you see dozens of moon-
windows creating a almost hopeful light in the
room. Shields, pole arms, and various other
weapons decorate the wall as with the arrow
slits allowing observation over the surrounding
area.

13968.name: {&Hall of Ascendance{0
description: Festooned with frescoes depicting many triumphs
over Shar. There is a happy medium in these paintings
that unconciously lead the viewer to the dome of the
Moon.

13957.name: {&Hall of Exploration{0
description: The last hall of the Great Library this hall
is more commonly known as a museum than a library
of books and maps. Lined with barometers, compasses,
clinometers, sextants, and tons of other navigational
instruments, these rare artifacts are from the legendary
expeditions such as the Haubwek of Sossal found by
Dabron Saschenstar of Baldur's Gate.

13954.name: {&Hall of Wind and Waves{0
description: All you can see is beauty at it's purest. More
commonly known to the nobles of Waterdeep and
devotees of Selune this transept leads from the
Grand Stair to the great mirror named the Eye of
Selune. A great stury mirror is part of the floor
in the middle of the hall giving you a fantastic
view of the church of the Moon and stars.

13940.name: {3{*D{&ormitor{*y {3of the {*C{&alle{*d{0
description: This long hall houses aspirants and acolytes
in a long row of bunks seperated by chests of
personal effects and thin curtains for privacy.
Thirty-two Selunites can reside in this chamber
at any given time, and the room is usually fully
assigned in this chamber at any given time, though
they usually are all assigned. During the day
you can usually find aspirants and acolytes
enjoying there moments of solitude.

13962.name: {&Back Passage{0
description: This narrow hall sees frequent use by lesser
ranking clergy hurrying to and fro. As with
much of the fourth floor, guard patrols are
relatively common along this passageway.

13973.name: {&Dome of the Moon{0
description: The rood of the House of the Moon is a grand
square terrace capped with a magical hemisphere
of moonlight. The dome is the capstone of the
temple and is the shining beacon of Watedeep's
skyline. At the will of Selune or the priestess
of the high moonlight, the entire dome can be a
impassable wall of force or vanish entirely opening
the temple to the glory of the moon. The four corners
of the roof are made from interlocking white marble
tiles carved to resemble various phases of the moon.
A permanant incantation cast upon the terrace makes
anything that falls from its roof be enchanted with
featherfall.

13919.name: {*{&Men's {*Jakes{0
description: One of the more interesting rooms in the
church the way the privies work is quite
amazing. The church's priest have put a green
carefully-cultivated slime in each cess pit.

13975.name: {WH{8a{yllw{8a{Wy{x
description: This short hallway separates the gallery
of the church from the spiritual room
located north of here.  Here on either
side of the walk north and south is lined
several panels depicting the ascension of
the Silverstars, the blessing of Selune
to mortals, the navigation of ships by
the stars, and other likenesses which
serve to instill pride and prostrate
oneself before entering the holy church.

13927.name: {&East Dome{0
description: Almost the exact replicant of the west dome
this room has been decorated from the windows
to the weapons exactly the same as the western
dome.

13953.name: {&Hall of Wind and Waves{0
description: All you can see is beauty at it's purest. More
commonly known to the nobles of Waterdeep and
devotees of Selune this transept leads from the
Grand Stair to the great mirror named the Eye of
Selune. A great stury mirror is part of the floor
in the middle of the hall giving you a fantastic
view of the church of the Moon and stars.

13942.name: {&Coversation Center{0
description: This one space serves as a lounge and place for quiet
conversation by members of the clergy. Comfortable chairs
and benches are scattered throughout the area, and an
informal protocol recognizes no rank while within the desmene.

13956.name: {&Hall of Maps{0
description: Part of the Great Library, this chamber contains
a almost infinte collection of maps and scrolls
acquired by the House of the Moon. Maps of all sizes
and shapes stuff almost every space. Some notable maps
detail the lands of Evermeet, Neverwinter, and even
Kara-Tur, Maztica, and Zakhara. Nothing being labled only
the near-perfect memories of the curators allow people
to find the maps.

13943.name: {&{*T{&ri{*for{&iu{*m{0
description: Allowing a perfect view of the church from above
this balcony and gallery is used to maintain the
overflow of followers from the church below during
ceremonies. A lot of traffic passes though the gallery
all the time and in respect the guards keep it down to
preserve the quietude of the sanctuary below.

13915.name: {&{&Ch{*ur{&ch {*of the {&M{*oo{&n {*and {&St{*ar{&s{0
description: This room is literally the spiritual and physical
heart of the church. From beautiful semicircular
arches to a beautiful altar that rest upon a crescent
dais. This room is amazing. To the east and west of
you are rows of pews mean for followers to sit and
reflect their belief of the lady of Silver. Atop th
dais a duplicate of the {&W{*an{&d {*of {&Fou{*r M{&oons{0 levitates
in its glass case, glowing with the silvery-blue light
of the lady herself. It is said that this grand chapel
can never turn dark and that sometimes Selune allows
her Silverstars to wield the true {&W{*an{&d {*of {&Fou{*r M{&oons{0...
A door is here leading to the Guest's Refectory.

13937.name: {&{*T{&ri{*for{&iu{*m{0
description: Allowing a perfect view of the church from above
this balcony and gallery is used to maintain the
overflow of followers from the church below during
ceremonies. A lot of traffic passes though the gallery
all the time and in respect the guards keep it down to
preserve the quietude of the sanctuary below.

13963.name: {&Hall of Learning{0
description: A teaching hall and weapons practice arena for
clerics and silverstars, hundreds of weapons and
shields are hung from the walls, and benches
sufficient to seat sixty students. Religious classes
are held in the morning, martial training in the
mid-afternoon, and collegiate-level classes at the
late afternoon.

13921.name: {&Cellar{0
description: This room is dark.. very.... dark. A few
faerie-lighted wine shelves are all you can
see. {1A small sign {7is hanging on the wall for you
to see.{0
++ Mystra Mob Quest ++
++ Directions: Say Quest++
++Requirements: Dont go improved invisible++

13905.name: {&Hallway {*of {&A{*rc{&h{*er{&s{0
description: A necessary precaution during earlier times
this vestige was designed to allow up to eight
archers to pin down anyone who wants to attempt
to storm the temple. At this time one guard mans
the garrison, usually talking with the six patrolling
guards.
You wish you could see what was to the south
of you but a large guard blocks the way.
The door leads to the Entrance Hall.. not very exciting.

13936.name: {&{*T{&ri{*for{&iu{*m{0
description: Allowing a perfect view of the church from above
this balcony and gallery is used to maintain the
overflow of followers from the church below during
ceremonies. A lot of traffic passes though the gallery
all the time and in respect the guards keep it down to
preserve the quietude of the sanctuary below.

13945.name: {&{*T{&ri{*for{&iu{*m{0
description: Allowing a perfect view of the church from above
this balcony and gallery is used to maintain the
overflow of followers from the church below during
ceremonies. A lot of traffic passes though the gallery
all the time and in respect the guards keep it down to
preserve the quietude of the sanctuary below.

13976.name: {WH{8a{yllw{8a{Wy{x
description: Another short hallway connects the back
of the church with the foyer leading off
into the main stairwell and the common
reflectory.  Aside from a wash basin
and a robe hangar, this hallway is
very plain in appearance.

13925.name: {$M{7i{&n{#st{&r{7e{$l's{0 {$G{7a{&l{#l{7e{&r{$y{0
description: As you walk down the Minstrel's Gallery you find
yourself looking down the ledge at the beautiful
pillars containing the Halruaan urn in the Entrance
hall. Everything seems so distant up here. It's
a beautiful balcony.... Beautiful ornate tapestries
wall hangings, and valuable pieces of the art make
most of the gallery and the rest of it is Naneatha's
legion of harpists playing their sweet, serene music
throughout the hall.

13922.name: {&{*S{&mal{*l C{&orrido{*r{0
description: This small corridor is almost as plain as
the common refectory. Sparcely decorated, this
hallway only leads to the grand stair and the
narrow hallway just west of the main church.

13906.name: {&Hallway {*of {&A{*rc{&h{*er{&s{0
description: A necessary precaution during earlier times
this vestige was designed to allow up to eight
archers to pin down anyone who wants to attempt
to storm the temple. At this time one guard mans
the garrison, usually talking with the six patrolling
guards.
The door leads to the Entrance Hall... not very exciting.
You wish you could see what was to the south
of you but a archer is covering the way.

13967.name: {&Back Passage{0
description: This narrow hall sees frequent use by lesser
ranking clergy hurrying to and fro. As with
much of the fourth floor, guard patrols are
relatively common along this passageway.

13950.name: {&Hall of Wind and Waves{0
description: All you can see is beauty at it's purest. More
commonly known to the nobles of Waterdeep and
devotees of Selune this transept leads from the
Grand Stair to the great mirror named the Eye of
Selune. A great stury mirror is part of the floor
in the middle of the hall giving you a fantastic
view of the church of the Moon and stars.

13959.name: {&Almariol{0
description: Serving as the storage chamber for religous
instruments and vestments, over sixty variety
of robes of differant sizes and rank are hung
from wooden poles. Passage in this room is almost
impossible being hindered by garments and hiding
in these garments is almost as easy as breathing.

13958.name: {&Chapel of the Full Moon{0
description: Used as the clergy's private worshiping chapel,
the focus of the shrine is the small is the
miniature moon, nearly fifteen feet in diameter,
levitating and dominating the entire shrine. On
more than one occasion, worshipers have been
bathed in moonfire emanating from the little moon.

13934.name: {&{*T{&ri{*for{&iu{*m{0
description: Allowing a perfect view of the church from above
this balcony and gallery is used to maintain the
overflow of followers from the church below during
ceremonies. A lot of traffic passes though the gallery
all the time and in respect the guards keep it down to
preserve the quietude of the sanctuary below.

13910.name: {&Ch{*o{&ra{*u{&la{0
description: This tiny chamber is used for the church's
choir to rehearse the hymns praising the Night
White Lady that will ring out day and night whenever
the moon is in the sky. The acoustics here are so good
that it can be heard all the way from the Narthex.

13926.name: {$M{7i{&n{#st{&r{7e{$l's{0 {$G{7a{&l{#l{&e{7r{$y{0
description: As you walk down the Minstrel's Gallery you find
yourself looking down the ledge at the beautiful
pillars containing the Halruaan urn in the Entrance
hall. Everything seems so distant up here. It's
a beautiful balcony.... Beautiful ornate tapestries
wall hangings, and valuable pieces of the art make
most of the gallery and the rest of it is Naneatha's
legion of harpists playing their sweet, serene music
throughout the hall.

13964.name: {&Antechamber{0
description: The room being modest in decoration, piles
of comfortable pillows and driftglobes dance
around the chamber. Rarely used to enter the
guests, it is occupied by Naneathea's frequent
guest and greatest ally, and languid moon dog
known as Lunapine.

13902.name: {&{*Na{&r{3th{&e{*x{0
description: The vast chamber you are standing in serves as the main
gallery of the church and as the gathering area for visitors.
During the occasional gala or after services the chamber
is filled with the hundreds of Selune's faithful, though
normally it is quiet and serene. Beautiful, heavy double lancet
doors bound in iron and large brass handles surrounds you
to the north, east, and west.
A pair of double door leads to the chapel
of the waxing moon.
A pair of doors are here leading to the chapel
of the waning moon.

13914.name: {&West Pantry{0
description: Particularly large for a pantry this room
if stocked to the brim with breads, fruits,
vegatables, herbs, and grains. Cooled by some
sort of brown fungus carefully locked this room
is the perfect storage place

13928.name: {$M{7i{&n{#st{&r{7e{$l's G{7a{&l{#l{7e{&r{$y{0
description: As you walk down the Minstrel's Gallery you find
yourself looking down the ledge at the beautiful
pillars containing the Halruaan urn in the Entrance
hall. Everything seems so distant up here. It's
a beautiful balcony.... Beautiful ornate tapestries
wall hangings, and valuable pieces of the art make
most of the gallery and the rest of it is Naneatha's
legion of harpists playing their sweet, serene music
throughout the hall.

13923.name: {$Th{4e {$G{4ra{$nd {$St{4ai{$rs{0
description: No noble's mansion would be complete without
a grand staircase which to make a dramatic
entrance. Cast with numerous amounts of spells
the sight of the highpriestess's walking down
these steps during ceremonies is remarkable.
The grand stair ascends in swooping curves all
the way to the fourth floor.

13930.name: {$M{7i{&n{#st{&r{7e{$l's G{7a{&l{#l{7e{&r{$y{0
description: As you walk down the Minstrel's Gallery you find
yourself looking down the ledge at the beautiful
pillars containing the Halruaan urn in the Entrance
hall. Everything seems so distant up here. It's
a beautiful balcony.... Beautiful ornate tapestries
wall hangings, and valuable pieces of the art make
most of the gallery and the rest of it is Naneatha's
legion of harpists playing their sweet, serene music
throughout the hall.

13951.name: {&Hall of Wind and Waves{0
description: All you can see is beauty at it's purest. More
commonly known to the nobles of Waterdeep and
devotees of Selune this transept leads from the
Grand Stair to the great mirror named the Eye of
Selune. A great stury mirror is part of the floor
in the middle of the hall giving you a fantastic
view of the church of the Moon and stars.

13907.name: {*Ea{&st {*Gu{&ar{*d {&To{*wers{0
description: These two tower was once useds as its primary
guard posts. With the enveloping growth of Waterdeep
all view from the towers has been squelched.
You see a metal ladder attached to the wall
seemingly going nowhere...

13918.name: {&{*Lady's {&Privy{0
description: One of the more interesting rooms in the
church the way the privies work is quite
amazing. The church's priest have put a green
carefully-cultivated slime in each cess pit.

13971.name: {&Hall of Ascendance{0
description: Festooned with frescoes depicting many triumphs
over Shar. There is a happy medium in these paintings
that unconciously lead the viewer to the dome of the
Moon.

13946.name: {&{*T{&ri{*for{&iu{*m{0
description: Allowing a perfect view of the church from above
this balcony and gallery is used to maintain the
overflow of followers from the church below during
ceremonies. A lot of traffic passes though the gallery
all the time and in respect the guards keep it down to
preserve the quietude of the sanctuary below.

13917.name: {&{*Pr{5ivi{*es{0
description: One of the more interesting rooms in the
church the way the privies work is quite
amazing. The church's priest have put a green
carefully-cultivated slime in each cess pit.
To the north is the men's jakes while to the
the south are the women's.
A small little {rcardboard{x sign is cheapening
the wall.
As you look to the north you start to smell something really funky...
As you look to the north you start to smell something really funky...
A kitchen with a old priest is to the east of you.
Maybe if you give the caddy a gold coin he'll
open the door for you. ;)

13947.name: {&{*T{&ri{*for{&iu{*m{0
description: Allowing a perfect view of the church from above
this balcony and gallery is used to maintain the
overflow of followers from the church below during
ceremonies. A lot of traffic passes though the gallery
all the time and in respect the guards keep it down to
preserve the quietude of the sanctuary below.

13911.name: {&Ve{*st{&ry{0
description: A small closet is here filled with various
instruments and equipments for the choir.
Parchments, robes, and silver bells litter
the floor from careless choir members.

13948.name: {$Th{4e {$G{4ra{$nd {$St{4ai{$rs{0
description: No noble's mansion would be complete without
a grand staircase which to make a dramatic
entrance. Cast with numerous amounts of spells
the sight of the highpriestess's walking down
these steps during ceremonies is remarkable.
The grand stair ascends in swooping curves all
the way to the fourth floor.

13938.name: {&So{*jo{&u{*rn{&er's {*Po{&rt{*al{0
description: A oval mirror of ancient constuction stands
at the end of this hallway. Framed in ornate
tarnished silver, the mirror radiates with magic.
All around you, you see recently fixed walls
burned with pyrohydra fire and sahuagin cuts.

13931.name: {$M{7i{&n{#st{&r{7e{$l's G{7a{&l{#l{7e{&r{$y{0
description: As you walk down the Minstrel's Gallery you find
yourself looking down the ledge at the beautiful
pillars containing the Halruaan urn in the Entrance
hall. Everything seems so distant up here. It's
a beautiful balcony.... Beautiful ornate tapestries
wall hangings, and valuable pieces of the art make
most of the gallery and the rest of it is Naneatha's
legion of harpists playing their sweet, serene music
throughout the hall.

13960.name: {&Grand Balcony{0
description: Giving a radiant view of Waterdeep's Sea Ward
and the mountains to the north of Waterdeep you
bask in the glory of the land. A row of pillars
with decorative urns are placed several feet from
the balcony and sometimes during galas the urns are
removed as to let people place there drinks on the
pillars. Guard patrols come to this place often giving
the excuse that it is necessary to observe the roads to
the church, but in truth even the crusaders enjoy
the view.

13944.name: {WH{8a{yllw{8a{Wy{x
description: This short hallway connects the hall of
learning with the chamber of the shard.
The walls are adorned with plentiful
windows that look out over the night
sky. Strangely, you seem to recall it
being daylight out, yet the stars in
the sky contrast brightly with the black
field of darkness behind.

13974.name: {&Pathway to the {&H{*ou{&se {*of the {&M{*oo{&n{0
description: A large brick path going to a even larger building is looping
around a small park and fountain.  A beautiful statue adorns the
fountain as it gurgles silently.  As the pathway ends a grand marble
staircase leads to the church.  Amazing..

13952.name: {&Hall of Wind and Waves{0
description: All you can see is beauty at it's purest. More
commonly known to the nobles of Waterdeep and
devotees of Selune this transept leads from the
Grand Stair to the great mirror named the Eye of
Selune. A great stury mirror is part of the floor
in the middle of the hall giving you a fantastic
view of the church of the Moon and stars.

13941.name: {&Conversation Center{0
description: This one space serves as a lounge and place for quiet
conversation by members of the clergy. Comfortable chairs
and benches are scattered throughout the area, and an
informal protocol recognizes no rank while within the desmene.

13955.name: {$Th{4e {$G{4ra{$nd {$St{4ai{$rs{0
description: No noble's mansion would be complete without
a grand staircase which to make a dramatic
entrance. Cast with numerous amounts of spells
the sight of the highpriestess's walking down
these steps during ceremonies is remarkable.
The grand stair ascends in swooping curves all
the way to the fourth floor.

13970.name: {$Th{4e {$G{4ra{$nd {$St{4ai{$rs{0
description: No noble's mansion would be complete without
a grand staircase which to make a dramatic
entrance. Cast with numerous amounts of spells
the sight of the highpriestess's walking down
these steps during ceremonies is remarkable.
The grand stair ascends in swooping curves all
the way to the fourth floor.

13908.name: {*We{&st {*Gu{&ar{*d {&To{*wers{0
description: These two tower was once useds as its primary
guard posts. With the enveloping growth of Waterdeep
all view from the towers has been squelched.
You see a metal ladder attached to the wall
seemingly going nowhere...

13900.name: {7Entrance to the {&H{*ou{&se{* of the {&M{*oo{&n{0
description: As you walk to the entrance of the House of Moon
you feel a quaint feeling of someone watching over
you.... Dozens of moon insignias decorate the gate
in a almost permanant set dance of eternal night.
You make the symbol of the Moonmaiden and walk across
the holy steps of her church.
A great pair of wooden doors covet the exit
north of you. Hundreds and hundreds of tiny
moon insignias have been carved into the doors
making it seem like a dancing mural of moons.

13916.name: {#T{3he {#K{3it{&ch{3e{#n{0
description: As you enter the kitchen you are instantly
attacked with sweet smelling smoke and a feel
of suden warmth. Like many castles, the hearths is
large enough the fit a human to stand inside nicely
A large tub sits in the corner, while on the opposite
corner a sealed pit is here containing a captured green
slime, used as a waste disposal.
You see the privies!!! YEAH!!!!

13961.name: {&Moontable Room{0
description: Dominated by a large white marble table a full
twenty feet in length this chamber is used as
Naneatha's office. Dozens of courtiers and priest
attend the room for the adminstering of the temple.
When not used as a adminstrative office, the Moon
table Room has served as a "peace table" of sorts
for various powerful groups in Waterdeep.

13933.name: {$Th{4e {$H{4al{$l {$of {$S{4hi{$ps{0
description: Another favorite of Waterdeep's mariners is the
Hall of Ships. Lined with hundreds of meticulous
models of Waterdeep's most famous sailing ships,
these ships evoke memories of Waterdeeps famous and
infamous early maritime history. From the Pride of
Ahgairon to the Sea of Shilarn, the most recent addition
to the hall is the Waterdhavian raker, Kiss of the Moon,
that sank fifty years ago from one of Velsharoon's
undead krakens.

13935.name: {&Sa{*c{&ri{*s{&ty{0
description: This small chamber is used for storing altar
vessels and vestments used in the four chapels
on the first two floors on the temple. Before and
after every service it is a hive of activity, but
otherwise it is treated as a large closet.

13903.name: {&Ch{*ap{&el {*of the {&Wa{*ni{&ng {&M{*oo{&n{0
description: Almost exactly like it's sister chapel, the
chapel of the Waning Moon the only changes it
has is that the mithril moon is a inverted crescent
and that the permanant illusion of the north wall
views deep into a mountainside cave with a shaft of
pure moonlight leading you to safety.
A {3gold plaque'{0 has been nailed onto the wall.
A door is here leading to the Aspersorium of Immersion.
A door is here leading to the Narthex.
This room is here for you to make donations to
this most sacred church. Give anything you wish
to the priest and the priest shall call upon Selune
to take the object!

13949.name: {&Great Library{0
description: One of the largest library you have seen this
gigantic room contains shelf after shelf of ancient
and old literature. Finding that all you have to do
is say the word wish to levitate to the highest book
you keep the word in the back of your mind for later
to look for that book on lycanthropy. Eight elderly
clerics of Selune, keeping watch in here and the adjoining
halls of the library, the hall of Maps and the hall of
Exploration.

13904.name: {&Ch{*ap{&el of the Wa{*xi{&ng M{*oo{&n{0
description: This small chapel is used during the week
by brief passerbys who wish to commune with
the Silvery Lady in her house. A beautiful
crescent moon revolves on air by will of
the goddess of the moon herself. A small silver
offering bowl lays under it that is said to
take all of it's sacrifices to the goddess herself.
The north wall is covered in a permanant illusion
making you percive a beautiful mountain ledge
looking of to a lush, green forest.
A {3gold plaque{0 is has been nailed into the wall.
This room is here for you to make donations to
this most sacred church. Give anything you wish
to the priest and the priest shall call upon Selune
to take the object!

13965.name: {&Private Chamber{0
description: This is Naneathea's private chambers. Wardrobes
and closets fill the bed and a circular bed floats
in the middle of the room. Whenever Naneathea has
some time off she can be found here laying back
looking at the moon and stars painted on her ceiling.

13913.name: {&{*Serving {&Room{0
description: A very plain room compared to the rest of
the church. This chamber is used prior to
serving food and after the meal to wash the
fine dishes and silverware.

13939.name: {&{4Ci{&m{*e{4lia{*r{&a{4ch{0
description: As you enter this room you suddenly drop your
jaw... All around you the riches of a thousand
kings fill the room as donations for the church.
Then you see a watch ghost and a clay golem rushing
towards you.

13901.name: {&E{*n{&tr{*a{&n{*c{&e {*Ha{&l{*l{0
description: The enormous entrance hall of this church is basic
yet elegant in it's design. Beautiful overhanging
reachs way into the sky. Three large marble pillars,
line the center of the room, adorned with Halruaan urns.
Suspiciously a few inconspicuous arrow slits hide in
the cracks of the wall, but basically the hall's
emphasis is on beauty rather than defense.
A great pair of wooden doors covet the exit
south of you. Hundreds and hundreds of tiny
moon insignias have been carved into the doors
making it seem like a dancing mural of moons.
To the north of you, you see a large chamber filled
with many visitors.
The small door seems to lead to a small
corridor...
The small door seems to lead to a small
corridor....

13909.name: {&As{*pe{&rso{*ri{&um {*of {&Imm{*ers{&ion{0
description: This small side chamber contains a single
marble font of endlessly bubbling holy water.
Through the cever use of pressure and pipes the
holy water is keep frothing. Guest are expected
to wash their hands and faces and drink deeply of
it's refreshing waters.
A small curtain leads to the Long Refectory.
A similar curtain used on the north entrance
is used here, going to the Chapel of the Waning Moon.

13972.name: {&Chamber of the Shard{0
description: This spacious chamber houses the most precious
work of art in the entire temple. The life-sized
statue of a Shard of Selune assembled from
a thousand moonstones hold it together by magic
that sways and glitters in the center of the room.

13969.name: {&Privy{0
description: Basically the same design as the church's
other privies, a carefully tended green
slime sits inside a pit.

13932.name: {$Th{4e {$B{4eth{4a{$l{0
description: Dedicated to the sailors that rely on the sweet
silvery rays of Selune, this chapel is mostly visited
by sailors and those who wish to stray away from the
cruel whims of the Umberlee, the bitch queen. A huge
mural encircles the room, depicting a celestial woman
casting her light upon a ship travelling to it's destination.
One or two priets stay here tending to Waterdeep's sailors.

13912.name: {&L{8on{&g {*Re{&f{#e{3ct{&o{8ry{0
description: As you enter this room you see a massive
banquet hall dominated by a massive oak table
over fourty feet long that seats fourty-five
people comfortably. Built for large occasions
this room is miraceously engulfed with moonlight.
Sweet, beautiful music is being played here as
the shafts of moonlight quietly dance across the
room.
A door is here leading to the Serving Room
A door is here leading to the Church of
the Moon and Stars.
A door is here leading to the Aspersorium of Immersion.

13966.name: {&Back Passage{0
description: This narrow hall sees frequent use by lesser
ranking clergy hurrying to and fro. As with
much of the fourth floor, guard patrols are
relatively common along this passageway.

13920.name: {&{6C{^ommo{6n {#R{3efector{#y{0
description: This feast hall is used mostly only by the
inhabitants of the house of the moon and hence
the common decorum and twin plain oak tables.
Several small driftglobes are here used for the
common sport at meal times. Though usually this
room is never used.
A small corridor is to the south of you.
A small hidden door directly down to you is locked and closed, wonder what it is...

credits: [99 FR HR] House Of The Moon

13900.name: {&A Kn{*ig{&ht {*of the{& H{*al{&f M{*oo{&n{0~
description:
{&A Kn{*ig{&ht {*of the {&H{*al{&f {&M{*oo{&n{0, one of the most
dedicated crusaders in all of Aber-Toril looks
at you, while at the same time wielding his 
goddess-conjured Moonblade.
13900.room_name: {&A Kn{*ig{&ht {*of the{& H{*al{&f M{*oo{&n{7 is here guarding the church.{0

13901.name: {&A Kn{*ig{&ht {*of the {&H{*al{&f M{*oo{&n{0~
description:
The Knights of the Moonmaiden are said to be
the most dedicated crusaders of all of Aber-Toril.
Armed with Silverstar-casted Moonwebs and Moonblades
this guard looks like a formidable foe.
13901.room_name: {&A Kn{*ig{&ht {*of the {&H{*al{&f M{*oo{&n{7 is here guarding the church.

13902.name: {&A M{*oo{&n Gu{*ar{&d{0~
description:
One of members of the patrolling group of
guards. He looks quite refresh for a twenty
four hour shift. Maybe is that restorative
addiction you've been hearing about.
13902.room_name: {&A M{*oo{&n Gu{*ar{&d{7 is here following his patrol.{0

13903.name: {&The M{*oo{&n Gu{*ar{&d L{*ea{&de{*r{0~
description:
A very well-defined man you can see that he
is a natural leader of men. Wielding a simple
two-handed sword he is ready to defend the church
with his life.
13903.room_name: {&The M{*oo{&n Gu{*ar{&d L{*ea{&de{*r{0 is here patrolling with his troop.

13904.name: {&A M{*oon{& Gu{*ar{&d{0~
description:
One of the guard's from the church's garrisons
he is fit, hardy, and strong. He is one of those
rare people who will follow his faith into death.
13904.room_name: {&A M{*oon{& Gu{*ar{&d{0 is here guarding his post.

13905.name: {&Nan{*ea{&tha {&Sua{*ri{&l{0~
description:
{&Nan{*ea{&tha {&Sua{*ri{&l{0, the current highpriestess
of the house of the moon is deliberate, proud, and more
than a match for most of the nobles of Waterdeep. Unfortunately
she is stricken with the guilt of not recognizing her beloved
goddess during the Time of Troubles. In compensation she has
been pushing extremely hard to spread the faith of the church.
Which she has done quite succesfully.
13905.room_name: {&Nan{*ea{&tha {&Sua{*ri{&l{0, the highpriestess of the house of the moon.

13906.name: {&A Priest of Selune{0~
description:
One of the minor priests of Selune, this person
has put all her faith in the thought that prayer
and sacrifice will gain Selune's favor.
13906.room_name: {&A Priest of {&S{*e{#l{3u{*n{&e{0 is here aiding any who wish it.

13907.name: {&A priest of Selune{0~
description:
{&A priest of Se{#l{3un{&e{0 is dedicated to the aid of all,
to direct all to the right destination, to show them
the trust of the moon.
13907.room_name: {&A priest of Se{#l{3u{*n{&e is here maintaing the church.{0

13908.name: {&A Silverstar{0~
description:
Being the most powerful form of priest in
Selune's church, a Silverstar can cast clerical
spells so great that all of Waterdeep would
shake. But the Silverstar will never do such
a thing. For a Silverstar is hope incarnate, the
moon's light at the end of the tunnel.
13908.room_name: {7A Si{*lv{&ers{*ta{&r{0 is here protecting {&Se{#l{3u{*ne's{0 holy relics.{0

13909.name: {&A ar{*ch{&er of {&S{8e{#l{3u{*n{&e{0~
description:
{&The ar{*ch{&ers of {&S{8e{#l{3u{*n{&e{& are a group of rangers being
dedicated to the idea that Selune wants to protect all
those who are in trouble and good. Donned in leather
armors and a bow made completely of moon magic they are
prepared to meet any danger being stricken upon the innocent
or the church.{0
13909.room_name: {&A ar{*ch{&er of {&S{8e{#l{3u{*n{&e{& is here preparing to shoot any intruder.{0

13910.name: {&A cook priest{0~
description:
{&The p{*ries{&t is here preparing the temple's supper
for tonight and at the same time muttering under
her breath. All sorts of dough, meats, and vegetables
are clinging from her garments with just a tweak of
sweat.{0
13910.room_name: {&A p{*ries{&t prepares the temple's supper here.{0

13911.name: {&A golem{0~
13911.room_name: {&A menancing {*g{&o{1l{&e{*m{& with deadly {1r{!e{1d{& eyes guards the {4Ci{&m{8e{4lia{*r{&a{4ch{& here.{0

13912.name: {&A privy caddy{0~
description:
{&A {*p{5riv{*y {&caddy is here offering you toilet paper
maybe if you give him a tip he'll give you some....
And you though this was a church.
13912.room_name: {&A {*p{5riv{*y {&caddy is here offering you toilet paper{0

13913.name: {&A Priest of Selune.{0~
description:
{&A priestess of the moonmaiden her duty is to
guard the Blaenther's bowl in which the sacrifices
of the sailors go into. Stout and homely
she smiles at you as you pray to the Silvery Moon.{0
13913.room_name: {&A priestess of S{*e{#l{3u{*n{&e maintains the chapel here.{0

13914.name: {1R{*espe{1n {*M{&oo{1ng{&lea{*m{0~
description:
{&Rescued in a unsuccesful mission on the Waterdhavian
raker, the Hare-brained Harpy this acolyte of Selune is...
not what he use to be. As you look at him handling a bottle
of sacramental wine with careless abandon you suddenly see
his eye flicker in unholy lights. A fleshy tentacle suddenly
grabs you and sends you reeling to the other side of the room!{0
{&BY THE GODS! TIS A GREATER DOPPLEGANGER!!! FLEE YOUR LIFE!{0
subroutines:
M GIVE 13913 wand~
M SPEECH 13912 quest~

13915.name: {&A small girl{0~
description:
Haneah, one of the volunteers to the Church of
Selune is not a particularly obediant person and
frequently if not all the time gets under the chefs
skin.
13915.room_name: {&A small girl is here hiding from the cook{0

13916.name: {&Ha{*n{&ah{0~
description:
{&High royalty from Cormyr, Hanah Kzaraod of
Cormyr has come to the House of the Moon to
make last conversations before her ten day
conferance with the ruling house of Waterdeep.

13917.name: {&Hanah's Bodyguard{0~
description:
{&Personal bodyguard to Lady Kzaraod this guy
has about the biceps the size of an Kara-Tur
Elephant.{0

13918.name: {&A Sparring Priest{0~
description:
{&A paladin-in-training to Selune, this young lad
is trying his best to harness the prayers of Selune's
chosen. Around his waist is a small wooden sparring
sword and all you can do is laugh at the poor pint.{0
13918.room_name: {&A sparring p{3r{*i{3e{&st is here practicing a martial technique.{0

13920.name: A worried mother~
description:
This mother while looking at a model ship accidently
let her daughter slip away from her. Please help her!
13920.room_name: {&A {!wo{7r{#r{7i{!ed{& mother is here searching frantically for her daughter.{0

13921.name: {&A {^f{$l{7yi{$n{^g{0 {&sage{0~
description:
{&Travelling all the way from Skullport this drow
sage, one of the few good-aligned drow, is searching
on a lost text on the Calimshan culture. His beard
starts to twitch wildly as he gets closer....
Ca.. Ci... Ch...{0
13921.room_name: {&A {^f{$l{7yi{$n{^g{0 {&sage searches a lost text on the Calimshan.{0

13922.name: {&a lady cartographer{0~
description:
{&Leaving her ship for just a little the madam
cartographer is searching through an ancient pile
of maps showing the clearest route to the true world.{0

13923.name: {&Lunapine the moon dog{0~
description: {&Naneathea's moon dog, Lunapine is her most trust compatriot.{0
subroutines:
M GIVE 13928 crystal~
M SPEECH 13927 quest~
13923.room_name: {&Lu{7napi{&ne, Naneatha's trusted friend and pet waits for her master to talk to.{0

13924.name: {&A Dancing Lady{0~
description: This woman is... perfect. And she smiles at you!
13924.room_name: {&A mysterious, {$b{4e{7a{&uti{7f{4u{$l {&dancing lady is smiling at you here.{0

13926.name: {&A small kid{0~
description:
This small kid looks strange.. Almost if he
wasnt a small little kid...
subroutines:
M SPEECH 13925 quest~
M GIVE 13926 map~

13927.name: (no short description)~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
